div.p: Vermilion is a bright red pigment containing mercury sulfide (HgS). It is the synthetic analogue of cinnabar. For its preparation, according to Theophilus (ch. 34), one took sulfur, broken into pieces, and added to it two equal parts of mercury. The mixtures was placed in a glass jar and buried in blazing coals until one hears a crashing inside, as mercury and sulful combine.Cennini (ch. 40) suggested, there are many methods of preparation and receipts and adviced his readers to buy vermilion from the druggists'.
Vermilion and cinnabar are almost impossible to distinguish analytically, since they have the same chemical composition.
